title: Getting Started with MATLAB Support Package for Arduino Hardware
description: This example shows how to use MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to perform basic operations on the hardware such as turning an LED on and off, blinking LEDs and playing sound on a speaker.

title: Control Servo Motors
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to control a hobby servo motor.

title: Measure Temperature From I2C Device on Arduino® Hardware
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware and the I2C interface to communicate with I2C devices.

title: Communicate with SPI Device on Arduino® Hardware
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to use SPI interface to communicate with MCP42010 Digital Potentiometer.

title: Push Button Control with 74HC165 Shift Register
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to collect large number of push button states with a 74HC165 8-bit paralle-in-serial-out shift register. This example uses four push buttons.

title: Control 7-Segment Display with 74HC595 Shift Register
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to control a 1-Digit 7-Segment display with a 74HC595 8-bit serial-in-parallel-out shift register.

title: Control LEDs with 74HC595 Shift Register
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to control multiple LEDs with two 74HC595 8-bit serial-in-parallel-out shift registers.

title: Control Motors Using Adafruit® Motor Shield V2
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to control servo motors, DC motors and stepper motors using Adafruit motor shield v2.

title: Control Rotary Encoder Knob
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to control a 12-step rotary encoder with a built-in push button.

title: Steer Two-Wheel Robot
description: This example shows how to use the MATLAB® Support Package for Arduino® Hardware to steer a two-wheel Arduino-based robot with closed-loop control.
